Medicine_tweet_108_r.News Finding: "Insomnia and migraine as closely related" as per researchers from South Korea representing various colleges –
Medicine_tweet_108_r.Paper Finding: Migraineurs with insomnia experienced a higher headache intensity and impact of headache (HIT-6 score) compared to migraineurs without insomnia (Table 3) .
Medicine_tweet_108_r.News Context: "Insomnia and migraine as closely related" as per researchers from South Korea representing various colleges –
Medicine_tweet_108_r.Paper Context: In contrast, insomnia has a significant impact on the clinical presentation of migraine. Migraineurs with insomnia experienced a higher headache intensity and impact of headache (HIT-6 score) compared to migraineurs without insomnia (Table 3) . It is possible that their distinct anatomy and pathophysiology contribute to the contrast findings.

Medicine_42_r.News Finding: This suggests that marine top predators are important in climate regulation, although they are mostly left out of climate models, Nevitt said.
Medicine_42_r.Paper Finding: Our results imply that marine top predators play a critical role in maintaining both ocean health and global climate.
Medicine_42_r.News Context: "The data are really striking," said Gabrielle Nevitt, professor of neurobiology, physiology and behavior at UC Davis and co-author on the paper with graduate student Matthew Savoca. This suggests that marine top predators are important in climate regulation, although they are mostly left out of climate models, Nevitt said. "In addition to studying how these marine top predators are responding to climate change, our data suggest that more attention should be focused on how ecological systems, themselves, impact climate.
Medicine_42_r.Paper Context: This study demonstrates that dimethyl sulfide, a chemical cue involved in global climate regulation, mediates a tritrophic mutualistic interaction between marine apex predators and primary producers. Our results imply that marine top predators play a critical role in maintaining both ocean health and global climate. Our results highlight the need for more collaboration and discussion between micro-and macroscale biologists working on global issues in the Southern Ocean.
Medicine_42_r.text: ['Finding: This suggests that marine top predators are important in climate regulation, although they are mostly left out of climate models, Nevitt said.']
Medicine_42_r.displayed_text: Finding: This suggests that marine top predators are important in climate regulation, although they are mostly left out of climate models, Nevitt said.

Medicine_87_r.News Finding: But data from two additional experiments indicate that this unintended increase in consumption can be dampened somewhat by requiring people to get the refills themselves.
Medicine_87_r.Paper Finding: Experiment 3a suggests that requiring participants to get their own refills alleviates the perverse effect of the free-refill response to a portion cap.
Medicine_87_r.News Context: This may have happened, the researchers surmise, because consumers wanted to get their "money's worth" - that is, they consumed more of the refill since they had already paid for it. But data from two additional experiments indicate that this unintended increase in consumption can be dampened somewhat by requiring people to get the refills themselves. "Taken together, these results suggest that this method of complying with a sugary-drink portion limit could have the perverse effect of increasing consumption," the researchers write.
Medicine_87_r.Paper Context: However, at least in this instance, it did not achieve the intended purpose of reducing consumption. Experiment 3a suggests that requiring participants to get their own refills alleviates the perverse effect of the free-refill response to a portion cap. Of 285 participants, 48.4% were male and 50.5% were female; 1.1% did not report their gender.
Medicine_87_r.text: ['Finding: But data from two additional experiments indicate that this unintended increase in consumption can be dampened somewhat by requiring people to get the refills themselves.']
Medicine_87_r.displayed_text: Finding: But data from two additional experiments indicate that this unintended increase in consumption can be dampened somewhat by requiring people to get the refills themselves.

Medicine_417_r.News Finding: "Pride appears to be an elegantly engineered emotion: It makes you pursue socially valued courses of action, and it facilitates the gains in esteem that make those actions worth pursuing."
Medicine_417_r.Paper Finding: This suggests that pride, rather than other positive emotions, is distinctively involved in social valuation.
Medicine_417_r.News Context: This may explain why pride is a target of righteous indignation around the world. "A careful mapping of this emotion suggests a different view, however," he continues. "Pride appears to be an elegantly engineered emotion: It makes you pursue socially valued courses of action, and it facilitates the gains in esteem that make those actions worth pursuing."
Medicine_417_r.Paper Context: Further, pride is specific to audience valuation: Emotions that co-activate with pride, such as happiness and excitement, do not track audience valuation uniquely and reliably. This suggests that pride, rather than other positive emotions, is distinctively involved in social valuation. Further evidence to demonstrate domain-specificity is needed, however.
Medicine_417_r.text: ['Finding: "Pride appears to be an elegantly engineered emotion: It makes you pursue socially valued courses of action, and it facilitates the gains in esteem that make those actions worth pursuing."']
Medicine_417_r.displayed_text: Finding: "Pride appears to be an elegantly engineered emotion: It makes you pursue socially valued courses of action, and it facilitates the gains in esteem that make those actions worth pursuing."

Medicine_tweet_14_r.News Finding: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity
Medicine_tweet_14_r.Paper Finding: This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk.
Medicine_tweet_14_r.News Context: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity
Medicine_tweet_14_r.Paper Context: By contrast, the control variables of culture, age, sex and previous charity giving frequency did predict donations. This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk. None of the monitoring primes we tested had a significant effect on charitable giving.
Medicine_tweet_14_r.text: ['Finding: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity ']
Medicine_tweet_14_r.displayed_text: Finding: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity

Medicine_tweet_15_r.News Finding: #PreventingType2 #breastfeeding  @username  breastfeeding  duration is independently associated with lower incidence of diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_15_r.Paper Finding: This study provides longitudinal biochemical evidence that lactation duration is independently associated with lower incidence of diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_15_r.News Context: #PreventingType2 #breastfeeding  @username  breastfeeding  duration is independently associated with lower incidence of diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_15_r.Paper Context: There was no evidence of effect modification by race, GD, or parity. This study provides longitudinal biochemical evidence that lactation duration is independently associated with lower incidence of diabetes. Further investigation is required to elucidate mechanisms that may explain this relationship.
